General Rules

1. All normal site rules apply.
2. You may not talk about this game outside of this thread or any Private Threads created for this game.
3. Please remain civil with each other. Things can get heated or intense, but there are several things that will NOT be tolerated. Absolutely no offensive comments or slurs based on race, gender, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, etc. I WILL force replace you.
4. This is my color (Blue). Please don't use this color or attempt to impersonate me in any way. Any other color is fine as long as it isn't too close.
5. Do not quote or pretend to quote any role PM, anything from a private thread, or mod communication. You can loosely paraphrase, but please use common sense.
6. Pretending to break a rule can result in the same action being taken as actually breaking the rule.
7. Do not try to manipulate or trick the mod.
8. Any minor/simple questions or pointing out errors in vote counts can be pointed out in thread by leading with a bolded @MOD at the start of a line.
9. Any more sensitive questions can be PM'd to me. Don't hesitate to ask if you have a question, you will not bother me.
10. If your spot in the game has been compromised due to outside information, please PM me immediately without making any more posts. I will be eternally grateful for your honesty.
11. I am not perfect. If you notice anything that is incorrect, let me know.


Voting

1. Voting must be made using the vote tags VOTE: Clumsy or using bold. I greatly prefer the vote tags though.
2. Any other variation will not be counted. I will let you know in thread once (if I notice it), but only once.
3. Misspellings, acronyms, and abbreviations will be valid as long as it is clear who you are voting for. If I perceive it as a vote, it is a vote.
4. Any votes within spoiler tags or otherwise concealed will not be counted.
5. A lynch will occur when 50%+1 of the votes are cast for the same player; a No Lynch will occur when 50% of the votes are cast for that option or when there is not 50%+1 majority by deadline. When this has happened, any subsequent votes and unvotes will not be counted, and the game will enter twilight.
6. You may continue talking after a lynch or deadline has elapsed until the mod posts to end the day. After that, you may not post even if the mod forgets to lock the thread.
7. I will try to provide vote counts on a regular basis, with exception to the times when I am at work (which varies). You may request a new vote count at any time, and I will post it at my earliest convenience.

Activity/Day Night

1. Days will last two weeks. Deadline extensions will be granted only for the case of replacements, holidays, or other extreme circumstances.
2. Night phases will last for 2 days (48 hours)
3. Replacement during night phase will extend the deadline to 24 hours past the point of the replacement, whether that slot has a night action or not.
4. Actions must be PM'd to me or bolded in the Scum PT for it to be accepted. If no action is selected, they will not perform an action.
5. If mafia have powers other than their factional night kill, they may perform their power and the kill at the same time.
6. Prods will be sent out after 48 hours of inactivity. These will be announced in thread. At player request (if reasonable), I can "Poke" another player. This will not count as a prod.
7. If a player does not respond IN THREAD within 24 hours or receives 3 prods, they will be replaced out. If they return before a replacement is found, they may keep playing. The next time they are prodded, however, they will be replaced and can not return.
8. If you will be unable to be active in thread for over 48 hours, please make a V/LA post in bold. As long as the time is reasonable, you will be exempt from prods.
9. Once you are dead, you may no longer post in thread. Please no 'bah' posts.


Sample Vanilla Town PMHello!

You are a Vanilla Townie.

Your powers include your voice and your vote! Use them well.

You win the game when all threats to the Town have been eliminated.

Confirm your role by replying to me with your Role and Alignment.

Good luck!

-Game thread-

Roles are being Randomized and sent out today. The thread will open once 11/13 players have confirmed their role and alignment to me via PM.

12/13 Confirmed

Game will unlock when 11/13 players confirm!

Game has been unlocked! Those who have not confirmed will have 48 hours from this post to confirm roles via PM or they will be replaced!

The local cinema, 7:30 PM showing of Action Guy 7. The moderately awaited sequel to the

mediocre series is about to have a different kind of plot twist. After the 30th samey fight scene

with the same kind of over the top explosions, the power cuts out. The dark room of the movie

theater is now pitch black, and a scream is heard. The lights come back on, and a fellow movie

goer is found dead in their seat. Panic starts, and everyone rushes to the doors. Every single one

of them, even the fire escape, is locked. You are all trapped in here with whoever committed the

murder. Everyone seems panicked and shocked enough... but somewhere, there is a killer hiding

amongst you. As the lights start to flicker again, it becomes clear you must figure out the culprit

hiding among the victims- and fast.



Votecount 1.0Not Voting: Martha Zolanski, narcoticcrab, kagesong, shannon, ThinkBig, JarJarDrinks, Save The Dragons, Blix900, TwoFace, Lowell, JeanDarc, ChaosOmega, Lil Uzi Vert


With 13 alive, it's 7 votes to lynch!

Day 1 ends in (expired on 2016-10-10 22:22:00)

Mod Notes: A simple reminder that the above and future flavor texts in entirely that: flavor. It has no bearing on the actual game.
I really hated Action Guy 1 through 6 but I wanted to give 7 a chance and I have to say this really ruins it for me.

My impression on ChaosOmega's response to Twoface and JarJar wasn't a display of frustration or selective reading (tunneling) per se. He was met with unsolicited responses in my absence and while he did come off defensive, he provided some reasoning and conceded that the questioning on twoface for "answering for Jean" was poorly worded. I recognize that exchange so far as an effort to make conversation and allow for more reads. I do agree on how the type of conversation debating "why/why not RVS?" can lead to a series bland and distracting posts.

Earlier on, Twoface opted againt RVS by flipping a coin (no one really knows if he did it or rigged it so he could get a tail). Save The Dragons, shannon, kage - they touched on flavour by the mod and a good chunk of players threw "random" votes. Each player has their own idea and style of generating activity.
I admit that I was in a somewhat funny mood when I explained my non-RVS stance but if you were to remove the sarcasm filter - I am skeptical of RVS because I question the true "randomness" in votes. We were given randomized roles already so why binge on randomness? There is also a general tendency to frown upon extended RVS and haphazard play.

@Uzi

The preview only happens when a new post happens after you hit reply.

If a new post happened BEFORE you hit reply (but after the last time you refreshed the screen) the preview wont happen.

I feel that the word "random" can have different contexts and usage to different people. I tend to think of randomness to a statistical chance - that a truly random event has an equal probability to every possible outcome. Comparable to assigning players to numbers, running an RNG, and voting someone based on that random outcome.
Most of the time I see random used to mean "without a base/reason, no order, unpredictable" etc. In mafiascum, I think it's a grey area. What makes a RVS vote "random?" It depends on how you stretch the criteria/your definition for randomness.

@Mod: VC update?

Blix, I wasn't here when you self-voted, but I would've hammered you. Feel free to skip this if you want to just keep playing mafia:

Spoiler: "Self-voting."
Getting yourself lynched as town cannot possibly help the town more than staying alive and trying to contribute would.
The latter is better because...
(a) If the town thinks you're scummy, you get lynched anyways, but you contributed more and more importantly you made the scum work harder to get you lynched, which gives the town extra information.
(b) If the town doesn't think you're scummy, you're much better off staying alive. Dying not only deprives the town of one pro-town voice, it also takes the scum one step closer to their win condition. Getting yourself lynched when you wouldn't have been otherwise is an "own goal."
(c) Even if you think you're going to be lynched, you can't be certain until the actual lynch, so you should keep playing to give the town a chance to come to its senses and decide not to lynch you.

Given the above, there are only three reasons someone could want to actually self-hammer:
(a) They are scum trying to cut off discussion or support a bus.
(b) They are a noob who doesn't know any better.
(c) They are a self-centered jerk who thinks that if the game isn't going the way they want, they should just take their ball and go home.

If someone asks to be lynched, there are a few possibilities:
1) They are scum. Lynching them is good for the town.
2) They are town.
- 2a) They have a protown reason for being lynched. Lynching them is good for the town.
- 2b) They don't have a protown reason for being lynched, and so are playing against their own win condition.
Kage should be at l-2
